title: Check out the translation for "toxicas" on SpanishDictionary.com!
description: Translate millions of words and phrases for free on SpanishDictionary.com, the world's largest Spanish-English dictionary and translation website.
text:
An adjective is a word that describes a noun (e.g. the big dog).
[adjective](http://www.spanishdict.com/guide/descriptive-adjectives-in-spanish)
1. (deadly)
a. [toxic](/translate/toxic)
Los barriles de residuos tóxicos que se hundieron en el mar están dañando el ecosistema.The barrels of toxic waste that sank into the sea are damaging the ecosystem.
b. [poisonous](/translate/poisonous)
Los cigarros contienen cientos de sustancias tóxicas.Cigarettes contain hundreds of poisonous substances.
A masculine noun is used with masculine articles and adjectives (e.g. el hombre guapo, el sol amarillo).
[masculine noun](http://www.spanishdict.com/guide/masculine-and-feminine-nouns)
2. (toxic substance)
a. [toxin](/translate/toxin)
Esta gama de cosméticos ecológica no usa tóxicos de ningún tipo.This eco-friendly range of cosmetics does not use any kind of toxins.
b. [poison](/translate/poison)
Los tóxicos vertidos en el agua mataron a los peces.The poisons that were spilled into the water killed the fish.

A noun is a word referring to a person, animal, place, thing, feeling or idea (e.g. man, dog, house).
[Noun](http://www.spanishdict.com/guide/masculine-and-feminine-nouns)
